Package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day5

Class SeedFertilizer

java.lang.Object
com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day5.SeedFertilizer
public class SeedFertilizer extends Object
Implements solutions for both parts of day 5, reading a line specifying seed numbers, then a sequence of mapping layers, each with one or more segments defining an input range and a corresponding output range. (An output range may be translated from the input range, but not scaled; that is, and input range and its corresponding output range have the same length.)

After reading the input data, parts 1 and 2 both require the same type of calculation—namely, find the lowest location value (the output from the final mapping layer) for any of the seeds specified in the first line of input. However, the two parts require different assumptions about the specification of seed numbers:

  • In part 1, every value on the first line of input is a seed number.
  • In part 2, every pair of values on the first line of input specifies a starting seed number and a range length. For example, the pair of values a b specifies the integral range of seed numbers a..(b - 1).
See Also:
  • "Day 5: If You Give A Seed A Fertilizer".

  • Constructor Details

    • SeedFertilizer

      public SeedFertilizer() throws IOException
      Initializes this instance, using the value of DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read. In other words, using this constructor is equivalent to using SeedFertilizer(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE).
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file referenced by DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} cannot be found or read.

    • SeedFertilizer

      public SeedFertilizer(String inputFile) throws IOException
      Initializes this instance, using the value specified in the inputFile parameter as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, parsing the seed numbers at the start of the file, then parsing each successive block of lines as a series of corresponding input and output ranges, together forming a mapping layer.

      Implementation notes:

      • Each mapping layer is normalized, filling in the gaps in the input layer, resulting in a continuous set of input segments, covering the range 0..(Long.MAX_VALUE - 1).
      • The individual layers are not maintained in the instance state; instead, after normalization, each layer is merged into a reduced result obtained to that point. The merging process replaces each segment in the merged layer produced to that point with one or more segments formed from the intersections of the output range of the given segment with the input ranges of the layer being merged.
      • The layer merging described above starts with a seed layer consisting of a single segment, with identical input and output ranges of 0..(Long.MAX_VALUE - 1).
      Parameters:
      inputFile - Classpath/package-relative location of file from which input is read.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file referenced by inputFile cannot be found or read.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of SeedFertilizer, invokes the relevant solution method, and prints the result.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file referenced by DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} cannot be found or read.

    • getLowestLocation

      public long getLowestLocation()
      Computes and returns the lowest final location number resulting for any of the seed numbers explicitly listed at the start of the input.

      This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.

    • getLowestInterpolatedLocation

      public long getLowestInterpolatedLocation()
      Computes and returns the lowest final location number resulting for any seed number falling in the seed number ranges listed at the start of the input.

      Implementation notes: This process does not iterate over all of the values falling in the seed number ranges; instead, it proceeds in a similar fashion to that described for the merging performed by SeedFertilizer(String): Each range of seed numbers is replaced by one or more segments, each with a corresponding output range (based on the merge mapping layers). Since the lowest location value must occur at the start of one of these segments, it is thus a simple matter to compute the final location value for the seed number at the start of each segment, and take the lowest of these values.

      This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.
